result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua Lee Kloos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $50 starting March 1, 2015. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No contact with H. Gohlke, T.J.G. and/or S.G.G. directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
The defendant must successfully complete Traffic Safety School.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: As to Count No. 1 Only
Associated with Charge #3
Associated with Charge #2
2 year Post Plea Diversion Agreement

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 3:30 p.m. Defendant Joshua Lee Kloos in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Ct 1 - Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 2 years. The court reminds the defendant that the bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the PPDA. 
Cts 2 & 3 - Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Cts 2 & 3 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by the victim. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Zamzow. The court for clarification purposes would like the information to reflect that the victim in Ct 2 is T.J.G. and Ct 3 applies to S.G.G. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 2 years probation - Conditions: Ct 2 only - 30 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than March 1, 2015. Ct 3 - 5 months WCJ - consecutive to Ct 2 - Huber, GT, No CFTS. As to both counts - AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ H. Gohlke, T.J.G and/or S.G.G., Restitution in the amount of $645.42 to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $50 starting March 1, 2015, defendant must complete traffic safety course, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Appeal rights given. The court amends the bond removing the driving restriction.
Restitution Summary - $645.42
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Joshua Lee Kloos in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Zamzow-requests a status/plea & sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on December 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Awaiting test results-court will place matter in suspended status and await test results.  Status conference scheduled for December 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:17 p.m. Defendant Joshua Lee Kloos in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. ADA Anderson requesting $2500 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Zamzow. Court orders $2500 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 09:05 am.
